text: incision and drainage with bolster dressing placement
context: incision and drainage with bolster dressing placement of right ear recurrent auricular hematoma.
preoperative diagnosis: recurrent severe right auricular hematoma.
anesthesia: xylocaine 1% with 1:100,000 dilution of epinephrine totaling 2 ml.
findings: approximately 5 ml of serosanguineous drainage.
she presents for suture removal; however, there is still fluid noted now at the antihelix fold above the concha bullosa below previous sutures placed by dr. x.
she presents for suture removal; however, there is still fluid noted now at the antihelix fold above the concha bullosa below previous sutures placed by dr. x.
wound care by the patient appears to be very poor if any at all being performed which may be complicating matters.
the patient is aware that the complications with this ear area severe and auricular deformity is inevitable.
a through-and-through keith needle bolster dressing was applied with cottonoid pledget on both sides of the ear to help compression.
